channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: War Powers Law Does Not Apply to Trump’s Boat Strikes, Administration Says
item.description: The move deepened the idea that a Vietnam-era law, which says congressionally unauthorized deployments into “hostilities” must end after 60 days, does...

item.title: The housing market, workers, and the economy are all stuck
item.description: “It’s not healthy for the economy that people are staying put,” said Daryl Fairweather, chief economist at Redfin.

item.title: An Outlier in Irish Politics Has Become the Country’s President
item.description: Propelled by anti-establishment fervor, Catherine Connolly was elected last week with a landmark popular mandate.

item.title: U.S. cattle faces a growing threat from a protected species of vulture spreading north amid climate change — ‘They just basically eat them alive’
item.description: “Honestly, the black vulture is one of the ugliest things I’ve ever seen."

item.title: Death Toll Rises From Hurricane Melissa as Many Communities Remain Cut off
item.description: Authorities have yet to reach dozens of communities in Jamaica, raising the question of how many people really died in last week’s storm.

item.title: See How Thailand’s Pets Become Speed Eating Contest Champions
item.description: Speed eating contests are part of a growing list of pet-related events in Thailand that also include competitions for skateboarding dogs and felines t...

item.title: He Stayed in Belarus for His Imprisoned Wife. Now He’s Locked Up, Too.
item.description: Two journalists, both in detention for their work, show how President Aleksandr Lukashenko’s repressive machine grinds on despite warming ties with th...

item.title: How Liberalism Wins
item.description: Democrats do not just need to win more people. They also need to win more places.

item.title: Women Need Workplace Boundaries — Not Remote Work or Flexibility
item.description: Discussion of women in the workplace often focuses on flexible hours, but what’s actually needed is shift work — pioneered by the medical profession.

item.title: An Outlier in Irish Politics Has Become the Country’s President
item.description: Propelled by anti-establishment fervor, Catherine Connolly was elected last week with a landmark popular mandate.

item.title: Death Toll Rises From Hurricane Melissa as Many Communities Remain Cut off
item.description: Authorities have yet to reach dozens of communities in Jamaica, raising the question of how many people really died in last week’s storm.

item.title: Fire in Hermosillo, Mexico, Kills at Least 23 at Waldo’s Store
item.description: The fire ripped through a store in Hermosillo, a city in Sonora State. The governor said 11 others were injured and that minors were among the victims...

item.title: Instacart, DoorDash, Gopuff and Zip are offering discounts to SNAP recipients getting cut off from food aid payments
item.description: DoorDash said more than 2.4 million of its customers have a SNAP/EBT card linked to their account.

item.title: It’s not just soybeans. China also stopped importing U.S. coal amid Trump’s trade war
item.description: U.S. coal exports fell 14% from January through September compared to the same time last year, according to an EIA report released Oct. 7.

item.title: Long lines form at food pantries after SNAP payments were suddenly cut off due to the government shutdown
item.description: In the New York borough of the Bronx, about 200 more people than usual showed up at the World of Life Christian Fellowship International pantry.
